conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
The user wants to add their public SSH key to their GitHub account. The key is located in `/system/.ssh`.
To achieve this, I need to first read the content of the public SSH key file and then use the `git_add_ssh_key` function to add it to the GitHub account.

The first step in the trajectory plan is `read_file`. The user specified the location of the SSH key as `/system/.ssh`. I will assume the public key file is named `id_rsa.pub` which is a common naming convention for public SSH keys. Therefore, I will try to read the file `/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub`.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have successfully read the content of the public SSH key file. The content is "ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr".
Now, I need to add this SSH key to the GitHub account using the `git_add_ssh_key` function, which is the next step in the trajectory plan.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
